item.title: A poem for Maths Teacher
item.description:
You brought numbers into our lives Alphabets you knew 6 and how I wish they weren’t algebraic Logs were tricky and decimals weren’t fun
but solved complex equations only for U Problems you had infinite from the book or life With solutions you nurtured logic and common sense Trigonometry was monotony until you came up with geometry. Oh! And I Never knew shapes would be this important
Until I met the gym coach He’s a constant remainder for size zero.

I might not remember all the math you taught I definetly don’t use all the math you taught But I still owe you a tonne not because you brought numbers into our lives But only because you breathed your life into us in our prime More true now that Binary and Boolean
provides us for our lives :)

item.title: Second Day
item.description:
Second day fiddling via the CLI and git and hugo. And here is a list of things that I have done.

  1. Tweaked my Zshrc config file with a bunch of UI hacks.
  2. Upgraded my command line tools to Big sur’s versions, it was outdated, surprising that I was running CLI tools from Mojave if I am not wrong.
  3. A first time ever 60 tabs on the current Firefox window, mostly due to debuggings.
  4. Learnt about submodules and how to get them working.
  5. Comparing VS code vs Sublime for use against git while also using github apps.

Thanks to the new SSD all of this is a breeze and I am not worried about keeping things within the 128gb partition of the fusion drive. Thats it for now.
